revised_title: Induction of Serotonin Receptors in Xenopus Oocytes using Exogenous mRNA
tldr: Researchers discovered that injecting Xenopus oocytes with mRNA extracted from rat brain induces serotonin receptors in the oocyte membrane. These receptors respond to serotonin, causing oscillations in membrane current. This finding could simplify the study of neurotransmitter-receptor systems in the nervous system.
